intro: Phaseolus vulgaris convar. subcompressus, commonly known as the flat-seeded common bean, is a botanical variant characterized by its flattened seed morphology. This subspecies belongs to the Fabaceae family and is native to the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with erect stems and trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. This variant is valued for its agricultural importance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
